trans-unit.source: Azure Storage Linked Service
trans-unit.target: Azure Storage Linked Service

trans-unit.source: The **Azure Storage linked service** allows you to link an Azure storage account to an Azure data factory by using the **account key**.
trans-unit.target: The **Azure Storage linked service** allows you to link an Azure storage account to an Azure data factory by using the **account key**.

trans-unit.source: This provides the data factory with global access to the Azure Storage.
trans-unit.target: This provides the data factory with global access to the Azure Storage.

trans-unit.source: The following table provides description for JSON elements specific to Azure Storage linked service.
trans-unit.target: The following table provides description for JSON elements specific to Azure Storage linked service.

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Required
trans-unit.target: Required

trans-unit.source: type
trans-unit.target: type

trans-unit.source: The type property must be set to: **AzureStorage**
trans-unit.target: The type property must be set to: **AzureStorage**

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: connectionString
trans-unit.target: connectionString

trans-unit.source: Specify information needed to connect to Azure storage for the connectionString property.
trans-unit.target: Specify information needed to connect to Azure storage for the connectionString property.

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: See the following article for steps to view/copy the account key for an Azure Storage: [View, copy, and regenerate storage access keys](../storage/storage-create-storage-account.md#view-copy-and-regenerate-storage-access-keys).
trans-unit.target: See the following article for steps to view/copy the account key for an Azure Storage: [View, copy, and regenerate storage access keys](../storage/storage-create-storage-account.md#view-copy-and-regenerate-storage-access-keys).

trans-unit.source: Example:
trans-unit.target: Example:

trans-unit.source: Azure Storage Sas Linked Service
trans-unit.target: Azure Storage Sas Linked Service

trans-unit.source: A shared access signature (SAS) provides delegated access to resources in your storage account.
trans-unit.target: A shared access signature (SAS) provides delegated access to resources in your storage account.

trans-unit.source: This means that you can grant a client limited permissions to objects in your storage account for a specified period of time and with a specified set of permissions, without having to share your account access keys.
trans-unit.target: This means that you can grant a client limited permissions to objects in your storage account for a specified period of time and with a specified set of permissions, without having to share your account access keys.

trans-unit.source: The SAS is a URI that encompasses in its query parameters all of the information necessary for authenticated access to a storage resource.
trans-unit.target: The SAS is a URI that encompasses in its query parameters all of the information necessary for authenticated access to a storage resource.

trans-unit.source: To access storage resources with the SAS, the client only needs to pass in the SAS to the appropriate constructor or method.
trans-unit.target: To access storage resources with the SAS, the client only needs to pass in the SAS to the appropriate constructor or method.

trans-unit.source: For detailed information about SAS, see [Shared Access Signatures: Understanding the SAS Model](../articles/storage/storage-dotnet-shared-access-signature-part-1.md)
trans-unit.target: For detailed information about SAS, see [Shared Access Signatures: Understanding the SAS Model](../articles/storage/storage-dotnet-shared-access-signature-part-1.md)

trans-unit.source: The Azure Storage SAS linked service allows you to link an Azure Storage Account to an Azure data factory by using a Shared Access Signature (SAS).
trans-unit.target: The Azure Storage SAS linked service allows you to link an Azure Storage Account to an Azure data factory by using a Shared Access Signature (SAS).

trans-unit.source: This provides the data factory with restricted/time-bound access to all/specific resources (blob/container) in the storage.
trans-unit.target: This provides the data factory with restricted/time-bound access to all/specific resources (blob/container) in the storage.

trans-unit.source: The following table provides description for JSON elements specific to Azure Storage SAS linked service.
trans-unit.target: The following table provides description for JSON elements specific to Azure Storage SAS linked service.

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Required
trans-unit.target: Required

trans-unit.source: type
trans-unit.target: type

trans-unit.source: The type property must be set to: **AzureStorageSas**
trans-unit.target: The type property must be set to: **AzureStorageSas**

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: sasUri
trans-unit.target: sasUri

trans-unit.source: Specify Shared Access Signature URI to the Azure Storage resources such as blob, container, or table.
trans-unit.target: Specify Shared Access Signature URI to the Azure Storage resources such as blob, container, or table.

trans-unit.source: See the notes below for details.
trans-unit.target: See the notes below for details.

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: Example:
trans-unit.target: Example:

trans-unit.source: When creating an **SAS URI**, considering the following:
trans-unit.target: When creating an **SAS URI**, considering the following:

trans-unit.source: Azure Data Factory supports only **Service SAS**, not Account SAS.
trans-unit.target: Azure Data Factory supports only **Service SAS**, not Account SAS.

trans-unit.source: See [Types of Shared Access Signatures](../articles/storage/storage-dotnet-shared-access-signature-part-1.md#types-of-shared-access-signatures) for details about these two types.
trans-unit.target: See [Types of Shared Access Signatures](../articles/storage/storage-dotnet-shared-access-signature-part-1.md#types-of-shared-access-signatures) for details about these two types.

trans-unit.source: Appropriate read/write **permissions** need to be set on objects based on how the linked service (read, write, read/write) will be used in your data factory.
trans-unit.target: Appropriate read/write **permissions** need to be set on objects based on how the linked service (read, write, read/write) will be used in your data factory.

trans-unit.source: **Expiry time** needs to be set appropriately.
trans-unit.target: **Expiry time** needs to be set appropriately.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that the access to Azure Storage objects does not expire within the active period of the pipeline.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that the access to Azure Storage objects does not expire within the active period of the pipeline.

trans-unit.source: Uri should be created at the right container/blob or Table level based on the need.
trans-unit.target: Uri should be created at the right container/blob or Table level based on the need.

trans-unit.source: A SAS Uri to an Azure blob allows the Data Factory service to access that particular blob.
trans-unit.target: A SAS Uri to an Azure blob allows the Data Factory service to access that particular blob.

trans-unit.source: A SAS Uri to an Azure blob container allows the Data Factory service to iterate through blobs in that container.
trans-unit.target: A SAS Uri to an Azure blob container allows the Data Factory service to iterate through blobs in that container.

trans-unit.source: If you need to provide access more/fewer objects later, or update the SAS URI, remember to update the linked service with the new URI.
trans-unit.target: If you need to provide access more/fewer objects later, or update the SAS URI, remember to update the linked service with the new URI.
